alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 6:16PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of central portions of Yellowstone National Park through 645 PM MDT... At 613 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm over Craig Pass, or near Old Faithful, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. ADDITIONAL DETAILS...People on area lakes in Yellowstone need to head to shore as very gusty winds will create choppy waters. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Grant Village around 620 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lake Yellowstone. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
